summary: Two transitive dependency vulnerabilities in loader-utils (CVE-2022-37601 and CVE-2022-37603) with CVSS scores of 9.8 and 7.5 respectively affecting the nyc-test-coverage package. Both vulnerabilities lack direct remediation as the affected transitive dependency cannot be upgraded.
userImpact: Users are exposed to critical prototype pollution and ReDoS vulnerabilities through transitive dependencies, with no direct upgrade path available for remediation.
rootCause: loader-utils version 1.4.0 contains two unpatched vulnerabilities: a prototype pollution flaw in parseQuery.js and a ReDoS flaw in interpolateName.js, included as a transitive dependency through istanbul-instrumenter-loader.
proposedFix: Upgrade loader-utils to version 1.4.2, 2.0.4, or 3.2.1 depending on the package structure, or replace/update istanbul-instrumenter-loader to a version that uses a patched loader-utils dependency.
resolutionDetails: Auto-closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was marked as ignored or no longer part of the inventory. The underlying vulnerabilities were not fixed but rather the issue was deprioritized.
keyQuote: This issue was automatically closed by Mend because the vulnerable library in the specific branch(es) was either marked as ignored or it is no longer part of the Mend inventory.
